page.title: 16DEEPING ST.JAMES'WATCH'
page.content: Watch is a club especially for people up to the age of 18,but anyone is welcome.The aim of Watch is to pro- tect wildlife,and get people interest- ed in it. Our whole school is a member,so any child or their parents can go to the meetings that are held from time to time. The sort of places we go to are nature reserves,like Hills and Hollows in Barnack,where we have seen plants such as bluebells,cow parsley,prim- roses,pasque flower and hawthorn. When we went to Ferry Meadows at Nene Park,Peterborough,we went bird- watching.The sort of birds we saw from the hides were lapwings,black-headed gulls,and greenshank. While we were there we also went pond-dipping,and caught pond-skaters, leeches and great diving beetles.
